studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added benefits and risks evaluation and updated study procedures in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Introduced off-site phone visit options for subjects on stable long-term single-agent therapy.
Modified tumor assessment schedule and central review requirements following primary analysis.
Discontinued IDMC reviews as the primary analysis has occurred.
Reclassified Duration of Response (DOR) from a secondary to a tertiary endpoint.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To allow for procedure modification in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and confirm benefit-risk profile remains unchanged.
To add flexibility for subjects on study long term while maintaining standard of care monitoring.
Primary analysis was completed on 03 June 2019, making separate unblinded management teams and certain central reviews unnecessary.
To limit cumulative radiation exposure for patients with long-term disease control and align with standard of care.
To clarify the reporting period for adverse events of special interest with delayed onset (MDS/AML).

studyChanges.afterText: every 12 weeks from last scan... must not exceed 24 weeks
studyChanges.summary: Updated tumor assessment schedule to allow for longer intervals between scans after primary analysis.
Changed Duration of Response (DOR) classification to align with the Statistical Analysis Plan.

studyChanges.afterText: reporting of myelodysplastic syndrome, acute myeloid leukemia, or any secondary primary malignancy
studyChanges.summary: Added specific reporting requirements for AESIs with potential delayed onset.

studyChanges.beforeText: Blinded/Unblinded TA MD and study teams
studyChanges.summary: Removed references to separate blinded/unblinded sponsor teams following the primary analysis unblinding.

studyChanges.afterText: Study Activities for Blinded or Unblinded Study Treatment Phone Visit
studyChanges.summary: Added a new appendix and table of assessments for off-site phone visits.
